name: RI_1_1_6_1_Evidence_of_Record_Entry_Output_Report_Event
title: RI.1.1.6.1 Evidence of Record Entry Output/Report Event (Function)
description: Maintain Evidence of Record Entry Output/Report Event
purpose: Evidence of Record Entry Output/Report Event includes key metadata, ensures health record integrity (and trust) and enables record audit.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit each occurrence when an output (e.g., report, screen shot) is generated from Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the organization where output/report is generated from Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the patient who is subject of the Record Entry(ies) populating the output/report generated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the user who generated the output/report of Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the system application from which the output/report is generated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the type of Record Event trigger (i.e., output/report).

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the date and time the output/report is generated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#08
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture identity of the location (i.e., network address) where the output/report is generated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#09
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture the rationale for generating the output/report.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#10
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture the data, document, or other identifier for the output/report generated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#11
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture when a Record Entry content output/report occurrence is known to be a disclosure, according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: RI.1.1.6.1#12
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture known and applicable permissions regarding Record Entry content output/reported including confidentiality codes, patient consent authorizations, privacy policy pointers.
